intro: Acidoton haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian acidoton, is a flowering plant native to Haiti. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and glossy, dark green leaves. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
